fucking shindol feelsbadman

Mike is right, its generally historically accepted Boudica suffered unjust abuse at the hand of Romans and that her dead Husband's final wishes for a even power split between the natives and the occupying Romans was ignored. She rallied thousands of her fellow native Britons rebel against the Romans and they caused a lot of death and destruction before the Roman Legion was able to mobilize. Its here where her lack of Military leadership became apparent. She had the numbers and it was her home turf but she failed to use both. Instead she went for a direct attack against a battle hardened Roman Legionary commander and his smaller but seasoned force of legionaries. The Romans played it smart and suffered few loses the Britons were steam rolled despite having vaster numbers.  Accounts vary on Boudica's fate, but its generally accepted that Romans never got the luxury of killing her themselves.
Historically, Rome was sorta justified. Celts were essentially white niggers who practiced human sacrifice and rejected civilisation.

This one is actually cannon, historically and DW wise cannon at least, i mean even in boudica's spirit origin it's said that bothe she and her daughters were "disgraced" as in flogged and raped, lost a battle then killed herself.
P.S. While she's a great politician that could roused the whole island of britain in rebellion to the romans she's actually a shittier tactician worse than Hitler, she literally fought the romans who has numerous advantages on an open field which of course, led to her defeat.

I love Boudica but I still love Nero as well. 

Just wish Delightworks would give Boudica some much needed buffs and updated animations. 

But this is why I hate war. People start and do it. To pillage and expand power. Asserting dominance and breaking your enemy is a strat and Nero did it masterfully here.
